Auckland.name: Pōhutukawa
Auckland.description: Known as the New Zealand Christmas tree, it is well-suited for coastal conditions and urban environments.
Auckland.benefits: Drought-tolerant, minimal maintenance once established, and provides vibrant red flowers in summer.

Auckland.name: Kōwhai
Auckland.description: A small to medium-sized tree known for its striking yellow flowers.
Auckland.benefits: Tolerates dry conditions, attracts native birds like tui and bellbird.

Auckland.name: Harakeke
Auckland.description: A robust, clump-forming flax with long, sword-like leaves.
Auckland.benefits: Extremely hardy, tolerates poor soil, coastal conditions, and requires minimal care.

Auckland.name: Shrubby tororaro
Auckland.description: A dense, wiry shrub with small leaves and an intricate, tangled growth habit.
Auckland.benefits: Drought-resistant, low maintenance, and good for erosion control.

Hamilton.name: Broadleaf
Hamilton.description: A versatile evergreen shrub that can be used as hedging or standalone planting.
Hamilton.benefits: Tolerates a range of soil types, wind-resistant, and requires minimal pruning.

Hamilton.name: Coastal Astelia
Hamilton.description: A silver-leaved perennial that adds texture and color to plantings.
Hamilton.benefits: Prefers well-drained soil, drought-tolerant, and low maintenance.

Hamilton.description: A fast-growing, evergreen tree or shrub with small, wavy-edged leaves.
Hamilton.benefits: Tolerates coastal conditions and wind, low maintenance, and can be used for hedging or shelter.

Hamilton.description: A large, native sedge with drooping, green foliage.
Hamilton.benefits: Ideal for damp areas, low maintenance, and provides excellent ground cover.

planting_and_maintenance_tips.soil_preparation: Ensure good soil preparation with adequate drainage to help plants establish quickly.
planting_and_maintenance_tips.mulching: Use mulch to retain moisture and suppress weeds, reducing maintenance requirements.
planting_and_maintenance_tips.watering: Water plants regularly during the establishment phase, then reduce watering as they mature.
planting_and_maintenance_tips.maintenance: Periodic trimming and removal of dead material will keep the plantings healthy but generally, these species require minimal care.
